sections.1_story_intuition: World Geography is the study of the Earth's physical features, continents, oceans, countries, and their interrelationships. It helps candidates understand global patterns, important locations, and the distribution of resources, which are frequently asked in competitive exams.
2_key_definitions: Continent: Large continuous landmass on Earth.
Ocean: Vast body of salt water covering major parts of the Earth.
Latitude: Imaginary lines running east-west, measuring north-south position.
Longitude: Imaginary lines running north-south, measuring east-west position.
Equator: 0¬∞ latitude dividing Earth into Northern and Southern Hemispheres.
Prime Meridian: 0¬∞ longitude dividing Earth into Eastern and Western Hemispheres.
Desert: Large, dry, barren region, usually sandy.
Peninsula: Land surrounded by water on three sides.
Delta: Landform at the mouth of a river formed by sediment deposits.
3_key_facts_data_points: Total continents: 7 (Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, Australia).
Total oceans: 5 (Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Southern, Arctic).
Deepest ocean trench: Mariana Trench (Pacific Ocean).
Prime Meridian passes through Greenwich, UK.
Tropic of Cancer, Tropic of Capricorn, Arctic and Antarctic Circles are important latitudes.
Great Barrier Reef: Largest coral reef system (Australia).
4_micro_notes: Asia is the largest and most populous continent.
Pacific Ocean is the deepest and largest ocean.
Greenland is the world's largest island.
Sahara is the largest hot desert.
Mount Everest is the highest peak.
Russia is the largest country by area.
Death Valley is the hottest place.
Vostok Station is the coldest place.
5_exam_capsules: Which is the largest continent? Asia.
Which is the smallest continent? Australia.
Which is the largest ocean? Pacific Ocean.
Which is the smallest ocean? Arctic Ocean.
Which is the longest river? Nile.
Which is the largest desert? Sahara.
Which is the highest mountain? Mount Everest.
Which is the largest island? Greenland.
Which country has the largest area? Russia.
Which country has the highest population? China.
Where is the Mariana Trench? Pacific Ocean.
Which is the hottest place? Death Valley.
Which is the coldest place? Vostok Station.
Where is the Great Barrier Reef? Australia.
Which rainforest is the largest? Amazon.
Which line divides Earth into hemispheres? Equator.
Where does the Prime Meridian pass? Greenwich, UK.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing largest continent (Asia) with largest country (Russia).
Mixing up longest river (Nile) with Amazon (largest by volume).
Assuming Sahara is the coldest desert (it's the largest hot desert).
Mixing up Equator and Prime Meridian.
Assuming Australia is an island (it's a continent).
Confusing Mariana Trench with Great Barrier Reef.
Mixing up population and area rankings for countries.
Assuming all rainforests are in Africa.

8_case_study_context.title: The Amazon Rainforest
8_case_study_context.explanation: The Amazon Rainforest, mainly in Brazil, is the world's largest tropical rainforest. It is vital for global oxygen production, biodiversity, and climate regulation. Deforestation here impacts the entire planet's environment.
